intro: Mesembryanthemum villiersii, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range from yellow to orange, bloom in the morning and close by afternoon. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
